intro: Phebalium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia. Its rounded leaves and clustered inflorescences make it distinctive, and it is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Phebalium rotundifolium is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
